title: Nerds Can Be Bees, Too
summary:
Key ideas
- Author Scott struggles with the concept of the "hive switch," or the ability to experience the sense of ecstatic union with a group
- Many readers expressed difficulty with experiencing communal emotions or group activities
- The author and his friends found belonging in micronations, and the rationalist community and could experience patriotic emotions once they found a group that was truly their in-group.

Key learnings
- Feeling like you're a part of a tribe or community is a crucial part of what makes life worth living.
- The inability to connect with certain groups does not mean that the "hive switch" is broken but rather that the group is not their in-group.

Key questions
- How can one identify their in-group?
- Are there some people who simply do not have the ability to experience the "hive switch"? 
- Can the "hive switch" be developed or is it purely innate?
